fear of possible bc diagnosis Emma56 Emma56
fear of possible bc diagnosis Emma56 Emma56

Posts.Content: Emma56 wrote: Hello, I recently found this website and discussion board and have read many of the postings here and been impressed and touched by the kind support you offer here. And would like to turn to you regarding my own situation. I am scheduled for a mammo/us/biopsy next week and the anxiety over the biopsy and especially a possible bc diagnosis are causing me so much stress that I find it very difficult to function. There is a large mass in my left breast and also other visible changes and I am very afraid of having bc. I am 51 and my mother died of bc when she was only 50 years old and I am having flashbacks of what she went through and the fear is so difficult to cope with, especially since I live alone without family and lack a support system. Would you have some advice for me regarding the biopsy (can it "spread" ca cells??) and which type is safer than others? And could you share what has helped you with the anxiety? Thank you in advance. Emma Dx 2/20/2008, IDC, 6cm+, Stage III, Grade 2, ER+/PR-, HER2- Dx Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: fear of possible bc diagnosis Emma56 Emma56
neoadjuvant chemo - but tumor not shrinking? Emma56 carpediempenny
neoadjuvant chemo - but tumor not shrinking? Emma56 carpediempenny
neoadjuvant chemo - but tumor not shrinking? Emma56 carpediempenny

Posts.Content: Emma56 wrote: Hello, I recently started neoadjuvant chemo to hopefully shrink the large tumor in my left breast before surgery and have had two cycles of dd A/C so far ( 4 cycles of dd A/C and then 4 cycles dd Taxol are planned). If there has been shrinkage, then perhaps only minimal and some days I think that the mass feels a bit smaller and other days when I don't. My onc. measured during the second treatment a week ago but wasn't sure either because the first measurement before I began treatment may have been more of an estimate. Is it "normal" to take this long? Have any of you had this experience that chemo didn't seem to bring you the desired tumor shrinkage? And what did you do then? Thanks. Emma Dx 2/20/2008, IDC, 6cm+, Stage III, Grade 2, ER+/PR-, HER2- Dx Log in to post a reply
